5.51.01.08.primcomp.name: Primary completion
5.51.01.08.primcomp.sourceNote: For assessment, look at 5 year interval starting 2 years before current year and count number of data points available.

5.12.01.01.unesco.name: UNESCO reporting
5.12.01.01.unesco.sourceNote: It will be looked at the 4-year-period starting 2 years back from actual year (e.g. for 2012: Years 2007-10).

5.51.01.05.hiv.name: HIV/AIDS
5.51.01.05.hiv.sourceNote: For assessment, look at 3 year interval starting the year before current and check data availability.

2.01.01.02.nabase.name: National accounts base year
2.01.01.02.nabase.sourceNote: It is being looked back 10 years starting the year before actual year.

5.51.01.04.immun.name: Immunization
5.51.01.04.immun.sourceNote: For assessment, look at 5 year interval starting 2 years before current year and count number of data points available.

5.51.01.03.mortal.name: Child mortality
5.51.01.03.mortal.sourceNote: National or international estimate is available for reference year. Reference year is the year 2 years before current.

3.11.01.01.popcen.name: Population census
3.11.01.01.popcen.sourceNote: Looking at 10 year interval starting the year before current and counting the number of population cenuses conducted.

5.51.01.07.gender.name: Gender equality
5.51.01.07.gender.sourceNote: For assessment, look at 5 year interval starting 2 years before current year and count number of data points available.

5.13.01.01.hlthsurv.name: Health survey
5.13.01.01.hlthsurv.sourceNote: Looking at 10 year interval starting the year before current and counting the number of health surveys conducted.

2.04.01.01.excncpt.name: Balance of payments manual in use
2.04.01.01.excncpt.sourceNote: Country has adopted either one of the two latest editions (BPM5 or BPM6)

5.51.01.01.poverty.name: Income poverty
5.51.01.01.poverty.sourceNote: For assessment, look at 10 year interval starting two years before current and count number of data points available.

3.02.01.02.fscov.name: Government finance accounting
3.02.01.02.fscov.sourceNote: Government finance data have been consolidated into one account capturing all central government's fiscal activities. Consolidated accounts for central government in place.

5.04.01.02.impexp.name: Import and export price indexes
5.04.01.02.impexp.sourceNote: Look 8 years back starting 3 years before current year

5.01.01.01.indust.name: Industrial production index
5.01.01.01.indust.sourceNote: Look 8 years back starting 3 years before current year

3.11.01.03.popreg.name: Vital registration system coverage
3.11.01.03.popreg.sourceNote: There should be a complete vital registration system (birth and death) in place within the last 15 years.

2.01.03.01.prcpbase.name: Consumer price index base year
2.01.03.01.prcpbase.sourceNote: It is being looked back 10 years starting the year before actual year.

5.51.01.02.malnut.name: Child malnutrition
5.51.01.02.malnut.sourceNote: For assessment, look at 10 year interval starting two years before current and count number of data points available.

5.51.01.09.water.name: Access to water
5.51.01.09.water.sourceNote: For assessment, look at 6 year interval starting 2 years before current year and count number of data points available.

5.51.01.06.matern.name: Maternal health
5.51.01.06.matern.sourceNote: For assessment, look at 10 year intervals starting two years before current and count number of data points available.

3.01.04.01.agcen.name: Agricultural census
3.01.04.01.agcen.sourceNote: Looking at 10 year interval starting the year before current and counting the number of agricultural censuses conducted.

5.51.01.10.gdp.name: Per capita GDP growth
5.51.01.10.gdp.sourceNote: For assessment look at 10 year interval starting the year before current.

5.14.01.01.povsurv.name: Poverty survey
5.14.01.01.povsurv.sourceNote: Looking at 10 year interval starting the year before current and counting the number of poverty surveys conducted.

5.13.01.01.who.name: National immunization coverage
5.13.01.01.who.sourceNote: It will be looked at the 4 most recent years with data available. The average of WHO/UNICEF estimate and government (official) data needs to be <=1.
